result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles R. Kuhn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders to add to current payment plan of $25/mo. beginning June 1, 2022.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample.

Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

11:34 AM Court reporter appeared via Zoom. Defendant Charles R. Kuhn in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  Defendant Charles R. Kuhn in custody.  ADA - Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim notification complied.  Agreement placed on the record by Atty Fuhr.  DE entered a plea of guilty to the charge.  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists.  Victim makes statement.  Court finds plea given freely, voluntarily & intelligently; accepts plea; finds DE guilty.  Court orders a withheld sentence and places DE on probation for a period of 1 year with the following conditions: court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Court orders to add to payment plan of $25/mo. beginning June 1, 2022. ba

Victim notification has been complied. Waives further reading of the complaint, charges and penalties. Plea of not guilty entered,  Bond continued.  Status hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 11:00 am. Pretrial conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 3:30 pm.  - rt

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with C.M.K. - dob:07-01-1977.
Initial Appearance set March 1, 2022 at 1:00 p.m.

2:00 pm.  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholas Smith appeared for Charles R. Kuhn.  Charles Kuhn appeared in person, in custody.  Victim notification has been complied.  Court finds probable cause for  arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $500.00 signature bond; booking no contact with C.M.K. - dob:  7-1-77.  No objection by Attorney Smith.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
